title: [Large-scale] Anaphylaxis Prevention and Management: Strengthening School and Community Response Capabilities

context.additional_context: Learners primarily consist of school staff and community activists, combining practice-oriented asynchronous e-learning content with live Q&A sessions. Mass enrollment is expected before the September semester.

learning_goals: Symptoms and triggering factors of anaphylaxis can be identified with 80% or higher accuracy
Learners can successfully perform the epinephrine auto-injector (EpiPen) procedure through a video simulation assessment three consecutive times.
Learners can develop and submit a project-based scenario for anaphylaxis emergency response protocols in school/community settings.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
